TEXT.TITLE: WALL STREET STOCKS LOWER IN EARLY TRADING
TEXT.BODY: Weakness in the dollar and a subsequent easing of bond prices underscored Wall Street's lingering anxiety with interest rates and inflation, prompting investors to take profits. The decline, though mild, was broad based. The Dow Jones Industrial Average, which recorded its 33rd record high of the year yesterday, when it passed the 2400 level for the first time, fell 10 points to 2396 this morning. Declines led advances three to two on volume of 19 mln shares. Bellsouth led the actives with a loss of 1/4 to 39-1/4. IBM fell 1/4 to 149-1/8. Reuter
